CatDescriptText: William Norvell, IBM worker, Fifth Ward was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, November 26, 1960, pg. 29 with question: "Do you think a Negro will be named to fill the police inspectorship vacancy created by the resignation of Inspector Albert Jones?" Answer reads: "No, I don't think so, because the police inspector's district covers too much territory.  However, there should be a Negro inspector because this will show that the Pittsburgh Police force is living up to the spirit of the Renaissance."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of William Norvell wearing moustache and tweed suit jacket, standing on sidewalk in front of street with automobiles and building with arches
